snippet: Activists are campaigning to change a 100-year-old mentality that they say trivializes the single most common cause of traffic incidents: human error.
abstract: Growing number of traffic safety advocates are campaigning to call fatal roadway accidents 'crashes' in effort to end broad apathy over just how serious impact of driver error can be; almost all crashes in United States, which rose almost 8 percent in 2015 over 2014, killing 38,000 people, are caused by driver behavior ranging from drinking to distracted driving.
lead_paragraph: Activists are campaigning to change a 100-year-old mentality that they say trivializes the single most common cause of traffic incidents: human error.

headline.main: It’s No Accident: Advocates Want to Speak of Car ‘Crashes’ Instead
headline.print_headline: It’s No Accident: Call It a Car ‘Crash’ Instead, Advocates Insist
